entry.title: The Year‚Äôs End
entry.content:
Prologue

Howdy, friends ü§† I‚Äôm so proud of your work these last two semesters. One of the joys of my job is to watch you grow and succeed. I know it seems trvial or anodyne work that anyone could do. But I don‚Äôt see it that way. You all achieve so much and are, in my eyes, building a solid foundation for your careers in the future.

Goodbye, I guess.

Seniors, congratulations and I wish you all the best. I have no doubt that all of you will succeed and thrive. SD grads have a practically 100% job placement rate out of school. Worst case, you have IT has a fallback. You are a valuable asset now. You are graduating with a degree and a technology toolbox. How many of your friends and peers have that same level of technicality. If you ever need recommendations, advice, or reassurance, reach out. Both Donavan and I are here to help you guys. If you want my phone number or anything to keep in touch, I‚Äôd be happy to give it to you. I‚Äôm also on Telegram and Matrix.

Returners, you guys wish you were the graduating seniors. Unless you‚Äôre Josh I guess. Have you seen those guys? ELITE. I‚Äôm not saying you guys can‚Äôt achieve what they did, but it‚Äôll be work. I think you can get there though. You guys have a lot of potential in your tummies. Make sure you say your goodbyes to those that are leaving. Those include: Mara, David, Stella, Hadil, Ikrom, Brian, Hermela, Jake, etc. These are also amazing resources to contact once you begin your own graduation journey.

Work stuff now!

Smarthub return apocalypse

I will be leaving on the 9th for a 10 day trip. This means that I will possibly miss you guys as you leave campus. That‚Äôs a bummer.

That being said, end of year means Smarthub returns! Oh man, oh boy, here it comes. I will be gone for that. I am relying on you guys to take ownership and total control of that process. It is of high importance we recover those devices.

The laptops are almost universally due May 14th by 5pm. This is the day after finals. I‚Äôm a little nervous, ngl (not gonna lie). Before I leave, I will be sending out an email to every student who has a loan reminding them. This will come from my own email address. As we enter the week of the 14th, set aside proper space to receive the computers. I usually tape off an area to delineate computers that are dropped off, computers that have been dropped off and returned, and computers that are dropped off, returned and wiped.

Please be very cognizant of what you are doing. Messing this up could literally cost students. Make sure to be diligent!

David, Jake, Ikrom, Hadil, Hermela, Joshua, and Garen. Take special note of the above. You all are working that day and will be handling all of this. Think of and devise some strategies in order to make that all come together.

Are ya winning, son?

The Superlatives are out! Look here: WOW!

I imagine you‚Äôve also seen it on your TDX desktop, right? Uh huh.

I have your prizes if you got one. Watch the vid and stop by :)

Required Reading

I‚Äôd Rather Read the Prompt Just a silly story I felt you guys would identify with

I would love for you to read these and talk to me about how you feel. Get a ‚Äúvibe check‚Äù, you know? Especially the first one.
entry.summary: Prologue Howdy, friends ü§† I‚Äôm so proud of your work these last two semesters. One of the joys of my job is to watch you grow and succeed. I know it seems trvial or anodyne work that anyone could do. But I don‚Äôt see it that way. You all achieve so much and are, in my eyes, building a solid foundation for your careers in the future.

entry.title: April reminders!
entry.content:
Everyone! Isn‚Äôt this RSS feed nifty?

First!

üöú Y‚Äôall better read Hadil‚Äôs post

She worked very hard on it and you owe her. Annoucement!

Second!

üöó It‚Äôs coming up on the end of tax season!

and fresh alumni may still need to access Homer for tax info! Here are some quick directions to guide students to their 1098-Ts:

  • Log into HomerConnect
  • Click on ‚ÄúBilling and Payment‚Äù in the sidebar
  • Click ‚ÄúTax Notification (1098-T)‚Äù

Also, take advantage of the Tax Clinics that Ben is offering in conjunction with Kari Smoker!

Third!

üöí Smarthub is slipping!

Gamers, please please make sure that we are returning things in Smarthub. There have been many times now where I have seen us not return or not loan things properly. We have to be better. Please reach out to the person sitting next to you for help if you‚Äôre unsure.Remember that student chargers are only a 1 day loan!

Fourth, and final

üöï Please refer to the previous desk announcement

about new student registration. Some of you definitely have not looked at that file I linked. Look at this image! See anything wrong? Why is it wrong?

I‚Äôm still finding hundreds, maybe thousands, of new student tickets without any tagging.

Why not read this short blog post?

We can argue about it next shift if you want‚Ä¶ Here ya go bonus article unlocked
entry.summary: Everyone! Isn‚Äôt this RSS feed nifty? First!

entry.title: Break Achievements!
entry.content:
Welcome back!

I hope you all had a restful break. While most of you were sleeping till noon and ignoring your parent‚Äôs subtle pleas to cook them a dinner for once, some enterprising and ambitious students were hard at work at the Service Desk accomplishing more than I really thought we could!

TDX Beautification

What words come to mind when I say ‚ÄúTeamdynamix‚Äù? Boring? Drab? Mundane? Prosaic? Banal? Well, no more! David, Garen, and Ikrom have poured their souls into making TDX a place that shows off IC‚Äôs natural beauty and embraces the bucolic surrounding of our little home away from home. Upon opening help.ithaca.edu you will now be greeted by the sweeping green slopes of our practice fields and the lake beyond, the floral gardens so lovingly maintained, and the cerulean waters of the majestic fountains. It makes you want to sing üéµ‚ÄùIthaca, forever shine your light on me, in my heart together we shall always be‚Äùüéµ

Please thank them when you see them. They have truly left an indelible mark on IT with this. I‚Äôll attach pictures below for your enjoyment.

Magical Forms, oh my!

Josh, also, was fastened to the desk and furiously typing, brow firmly furrowed. He forged new forms most fondly. Fair, my fellow to figure for what this form facilitates. Forsooth, fathom no further. For he has faceted field after field to fabricate a form most fabled. Find this form, friend, festooned [here]. Frankly, I‚Äôm fully flabbergasted at his fortitude. He fights with a fiery furor that flumoxes me as he makes, in fact, fifteen fifty. Thanks F‚ÄôJosh!

Pictures!

entry.title: Intercom Changes LIVE!
entry.content:
Intercom updates

Intercom is now be behind a login screen. Only current students, faculty, staff, and affiliates are able to view it. Retirees can as well, but not alumni. Review the Intercom article in the Teams General chat for more info. Be prepared for an influx of SSPR and DUO requests as people who have never had to sign in will now have to.
entry.summary: Intercom updates Intercom is now be behind a login screen. Only current students, faculty, staff, and affiliates are able to view it. Retirees can as well, but not alumni. Review the Intercom article in the Teams General chat for more info. Be prepared for an influx of SSPR and DUO requests as people who have never had to sign in will now have to.

entry.title: Pre2013Alum Update to SSPR Form
entry.content:
Pre-2013 Alumni Requests

There has been an additional question added to the SSPR form. ‚ÄúIs this a request for an alumni that graduated before 2013?‚Äù. Answering yes to this questions gives another process for you to follow that is specific to Alumni who graduated before 2013. Check it out!
entry.summary: Pre-2013 Alumni Requests There has been an additional question added to the SSPR form. ‚ÄúIs this a request for an alumni that graduated before 2013?‚Äù. Answering yes to this questions gives another process for you to follow that is specific to Alumni who graduated before 2013. Check it out!

entry.title: Duo and SSPR response changes!
entry.content:
1 day response window

We are changing from a 3 business day to a 1 business day response time for SSPR and Duo tickets. This is all an effort to reduce the amount of tickets sitting in the queue. The logic is that if a user isn‚Äôt responding to getting access to their account, how urgent is it? Everything else stays the same when it comes to closing and how we respond.
entry.summary: 1 day response window We are changing from a 3 business day to a 1 business day response time for SSPR and Duo tickets. This is all an effort to reduce the amount of tickets sitting in the queue. The logic is that if a user isn‚Äôt responding to getting access to their account, how urgent is it? Everything else stays the same when it comes to closing and how we respond.

entry.title: Toshiba Attribute
entry.content:
Printers TDX Update

There is a new attribute in TDX to see if a printer is covered under Toshiba‚Äôs warranty! See if you can find it
